en.title: Graphics Engineer, Digital Cartographer, Car Enthusiast, Journalist, Noodle Connoisseur
en.author: Daniel Kao
en.description: I spend my days crunching data and visualizing data for autonomous vehicle models.

content.value: I spend my days crunching data and visualizing data for autonomous vehicle models, currently as an engineer for Rivian Automotive.

Previously, I was an engineer for The Washington Post, graphics engineer for Commonwealth Magazine and frontend engineer for the New York Times. I completed my graduate studies in Cartography and Geographic Information Systems at the University of Wisconsin and undergraduate studies in Computer Science at the University of California, San Diego.

I'm motivated by the idea that digital mediums can help people better understand and solve the complex challenges facing societies today. A selection of previous works can be seen here. My resume is available here.

More broadly, I’m interested in the interplay of technology, maps, politics, journalism, international relations, democracy, and education. My spare time is spent playing with cameras, wrenching on cars, eating noodles, surfing, reading, and traveling.

zh.title: 資料視覺化前端工程師、數位地理資訊學者、湯麵愛好者
zh.author: Daniel Kao
zh.description: 我專門發想以及製作資料視覺化。

content.value: 當前，我是 Rivian Automotive 的工程師。
之前在 華盛頓郵報 負責選舉資料和視覺化的前端工程師。在台灣的時候在 天下雜誌 當前端工程師，專門發想以及製作新聞的視覺化。更之前在 紐約時報 當前端工程師。我的碩士唸威斯康星大學的地理資訊以及大學唸加州大學聖地牙哥的資訊工程。
帶著資工背景，我的初衷是希望運用數位時代的新興技術呈現各種社會複雜的訴求，讓讀者對於切身相關的議題能夠有更好的了解。可以在這裡看我的作品集，也可以下載我的履歷。
此外，我也對科技、地圖、政治、國際、民主和教育有興趣。我其他的時間喜歡玩相機、修車、吃麵、衝浪、看書和旅遊。
